Container.Name: sealskin
Container.Overview: Sealskin(https://github.com/selkies-project/sealskin/) is a self-hosted, client-server platform that enables users to run powerful, containerized desktop applications streamed directly to a web browser. It uses a browser extension to intercept user actionsâ€”such as clicking a link or downloading a file and redirects them to a secure, isolated application environment running on a remote server.
Container.Changes:
### 2026-01-17 - Update docs to remove network and port requirement, add link to Firefox add on.
### 2026-01-08 - Improve permission fixing.
### 2025-10-31 - Initial Release.

Config.Name: WebUI
Config.Description: HTTPS Sessions and API communication port.

Config.Name: Appdata
Config.Description: All configuration files and metadata for the application.

Config.Name: Path: /storage
Config.Description: All file storage for home directories and ephemeral mounts.

Config.Name: Path: /var/run/docker.sock
Config.Description: Docker socket, required to spin up application containers.

Config.Name: HOST_URL
Config.Description: On initial setup this will be used to fill in the default admin configuration file in the `/config` directory, if unset the string HOST_URL will need to be replaced.
